description: this is a horrible flight simulator. all the aircraft suck, Graphics are slow and bad looking, crashes, feels unfinished, UI feels broken. it just feels bad.

For me it is more realistic than MFS
good and fun for the price ;)

Besides being a huge pile of bugs, it is on the verge of being arcade.
If you want a nice and reliable flight sim for practicing your skills, this is definitely not the one you are looking for. The controls are horrible, all the menus and user interactions feel like they were thrown together ad-hoc without giving any thought. The flight modelling is, to say the least, far from satisfactory. The only thing A-OK about this junk is the scenery, but then again, loading/downloading of it is buggy, just like virtually all the rest of the application. In the course of a few hours of testing (or rather trying to test it), I've exprienced crashes, freezes, loss of sound, loading failures, and quite a couple of other problems.

On top of all this, it seems to be resource hungry. Despite having a decent machine, I couldn't manage to avoid serious hickups with acceptable appearance. Since dealing with settings is a nightmare, that one didn't help either.

I'm now left wondering why anyone on this planet would recommend it. All in all, if you're any serious about your flight simulation sessions, forget FlightGear for good.
Apart from the occasional bug, and that for some reason I can't install more aircraft, it is just BRILLIANT! :-)

I like this, because if you want more efficiency, you can look for more implementations and develop for yourself ...
This is not for a person without experience in Linux systems ...
But it sure is the best guide to introduce yourself to programming if you are a persistent person to fix everything you will learn only with a tutorial of any meaning you want to process of the Linux Community to become a great Linux Programmer systems

description: i hate it because i cant even open the app!:(

Impressive work, but i uninstalled it after two frustrating hours:
Controlling the user interface needs more concentration than controlling the plane. Helpfile is incomplete and internet search is needed to survive the very first scenery.
Graphics are great, but performance is very poor.
It just crashes while loading. Unhelpful error message. A problem occurred. Yeah. lol

This tends to be a full-sim software and that kills all the fun "nonflying" users might have with it. The detailed aircraft operating requirements are - a killer.

As for the bugs, the aircraft was permanently stuck in left turn loop, without the possibility to compensate. This has been present since like...forever (because I tried the previous version as well). Note to developers - FIX THIS.

On the resource side, it is a flying simulator so - it is HUNGRY. Definitely not for the older or weaker machines.

All in all, a bit disappointing, as the one expects some scenic flying and ends up battling the plane. Hopefully next versions will be better.

Great! Well designed! Better than microsof't cuz it uses tons less bandwidth and requires less power with almost as good graphics.  If you are a noob that crashes the plane, you would make a bad pilot. This is not meant to be a game, but a simulator. That means it simulates real life. It is also really light; you get plyable fps on raspberry pi!

Total utter junk. Not only it is a nightmare in terms of UI/UX, it is also riddled with bugs, keeps crashing randomly, and, to add insult to the injury, the flight models are not even remotely realistic.
It caters with lovely detail in terms of procedures, and then fails big time to deliver the very core thing a flight simulator is supposed to do.
It's very hard to appreciate the fact that it's free when it is completely unusable for what it is supposedly meant for. I honestly hope the developers already quit, as this piece has been absolute garbage since a long time ago, and hasn't improved even a little bit in years of development, up to 2020.3.12.
If you're any serious about aviation, FG won't help you much.

description: Free, open source, stable (at least for me!), and fun! What more can you ask for?

First off I wanted to acknowledge that this game does require some extra setup by the end user after it is installed. A lot of reviews were panning this game as dreadful and I believe, from my personal experience, they are way off. Keep in mind this game is freeware made by people in their spare time as a hobby.

I will say this I had issues when I first played it. I couldn't get scenery to download even after I clicked download scenery online in settings. It kept failing no matter what. I then manually set DNS to 9.9.9.9 and 1.1.1.1 instead of using Google option and it was able to use those two DNS servers to download scenery without much issue. It is a bit slow sometimes as you can select most known airports in the world which is a lot. I looked at the avilable list of completed airports. St. Pete/ Clearwater wasn't one of them but, it's somewhat close to me. After I fixed the DNS issue, the game downloaded the scenery and building placement generated from GPS/ mapping software it is pulling from. It didn't look exactly like St. Pete but I275 was there in game, the airport was pretty good, as were most major roadways and again, this is not a modeled airport.

Flight model is pretty good. Most of the extra aircraft and helicopters work, some don't. It's all people creating these addons for free as a hobby. Biggest dissapointment was no crash model by default. I looked and you can modify the aircraft in their settings to add code for crash model but meh. The flight model is pretty good, ingame help is okay as far as tellign you waht to do. it recognized my old Logitech joystick with no issues. It's fun. Still got a lot to learn like communicating with ATC. overall I can't believe it's this good even for free. Also it scales well from older systems to more powerful systems. You will need at least a 2 gig PCIE video card and preferably a six core processor for it to run well.

description: Großartiger Flugsimulator mit realitätsnahen Einstellmöglichkeiten

Da das Programm mit 2,5 GB nicht sehr klein ist, bedarf es an Zeit bis es für die Installation herunter geladen wurde.

Für die Ungeduldigen. Bitte einfach in dem Terminal (ohne Hochkommas) 'sudo dnf install FlightGear' einfügen und allen Installationsereignissen geduldig zuschauen.

Dann nur noch starten und Fliegen lernen 

Bis auf die Grafik macht es einen recht guten Eindruck.

Vielen Dank

Mit Abstand der beste frei verfügbare Flugsimulator überhaupt!
Große aktive Community, guter Support über das Forum: forum.flightgear.org
Ausführliche Dokumentation: wiki.flightgear.org
Riesige Auswahl an Flugzeugen!
Auf jeden Fall eine ganz klare Empfehlung!

Ich wollte es über die Graphische Oberfläche installieren, da stand trotz schnellem Prozessor und SSD ewig "Preparing...", also habe ich auf "Abbrechen" geklickt und das Programm über das Terminal installiert:

sudo apt install flightgear

Da startet's sofort nach Eingabe des Passwortes die Installation, fragt nach einer Weile nochmal, drückt man dann auf Enter, installiert er es problemlos.

Zum Programm selber:
Es funktioniert gut und ist ein toller kostenloser Ersatz für den Microsoft Flight Simulator X(Und graphisch genau so gut)!

Und das sind die Meldungen, wenn man es über das Terminal installieren möchte:
"Die folgenden Pakete haben unerfüllte Abhängigkeiten:
 flightgear : Hängt ab von: libopenscenegraph160 soll aber nicht installiert werden
Probleme können nicht korrigiert werden, Sie haben zurückgehaltene defekte Pakete."
Es un buen simulador.
